item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 24, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. AWS data center latencies, visualized (134 points | 49 comments)
2. Show HN: Wall-mounted diffusion mirror that turns reflections into paintings (256 points | 53 comments)
3. Pretty.c (78 points | 29 comments)
4. Show HN: RF Hunter – Find hidden cameras and other devices (110 points | 50 comments)
5. Everything I built with Claude Artifacts this week (515 points | 368 comments)
6. NetGuard – rootless Android outbound per-app OSS firewall, like LittleSnitch (74 points | 32 comments)
7. Playstation Vita Architecture (Part 1) (174 points | 56 comments)
8. What happens when you make a move in lichess.org? (243 points | 105 comments)
9. How do merging supermassive black holes pass the final parsec? (31 points | 20 comments)
10. Show HN: Open-source low-code email editor (100 points | 19 comments)
11. Necromanteion of Acheron (25 points | 5 comments)
12. Fearless SSH: Short-lived certificates bring Zero Trust to infrastructure (96 points | 75 comments)
13. Goodbye from a Linux Community Volunteer (82 points | 34 comments)
14. Async Rust in Three Parts (131 points | 32 comments)
15. Implementing attributes for plain text using subranges like Emacs (6 points | discuss)
16. Probably pay attention to tokenizers (216 points | 68 comments)
17. Apple may stop producing Vision Pro by the end of 2024 (91 points | 189 comments)
18. My NumPy year: Creating a DType for the next generation of scientific computing (52 points | 4 comments)
19. TSMC cuts off client after discovering chips sent to Huawei (156 points | 71 comments)
20. Postbox has been acquired by eM Client (57 points | 20 comments)
21. OOP is not that bad (79 points | 158 comments)
22. Launch HN: GPT Driver (YC S21) – End-to-end app testing in natural language (99 points | 74 comments)
23. A DSL for peephole transformation rules of integer operations in the PyPy JIT (89 points | 7 comments)
24. Rust in enterprise kernels (48 points | 7 comments)
25. Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction (2018) (74 points | 15 comments)
26. Irreproducible Results (2011) (30 points | 16 comments)
27. Show HN: I built a task manager that separates "do" and "due" dates (120 points | 53 comments)
28. Chromium uses web search for .internal TLD instead of opening URL (70 points | 46 comments)
29. The Tragedy of Google Books (2017) (407 points | 162 comments)
30. Parks on the Air (90 points | 45 comments)
